speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: SCENE VI. A chamber in a farmhouse adjoining the castle.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, KING LEAR, KENT, Fool, and EDGAR

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here is better than the open air; take it

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: thankfully. I will piece out the comfort with what

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: addition I can: I will not be long from you.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: All the power of his wits have given way to his

speaker: KENT
text_entry: impatience: the gods reward your kindness!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exit GLOUCESTER

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Frateretto calls me; and tells me

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Nero is an angler in the lake of darkness.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Pray, innocent, and beware the foul fiend.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Prithee, nuncle, tell me whether a madman be a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: gentleman or a yeoman?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A king, a king!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No, he's a yeoman that has a gentleman to his son;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: for he's a mad yeoman that sees his son a gentleman

speaker: Fool
text_entry: before him.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To have a thousand with red burning spits

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come hissing in upon 'em,--

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The foul fiend bites my back.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He's mad that trusts in the tameness of a wolf, a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: horse's health, a boy's love, or a whore's oath.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: It shall be done; I will arraign them straight.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To EDGAR

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come, sit thou here, most learned justicer;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou, sapient sir, sit here. Now, you she foxes!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Look, where he stands and glares!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Wantest thou eyes at trial, madam?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Come o'er the bourn, Bessy, to me,--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Her boat hath a leak,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And she must not speak

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why she dares not come over to thee.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The foul fiend haunts poor Tom in the voice of a

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: nightingale. Hopdance cries in Tom's belly for two

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: white herring. Croak not, black angel; I have no

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: food for thee.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: How do you, sir? Stand you not so amazed:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Will you lie down and rest upon the cushions?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll see their trial first. Bring in the evidence.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To EDGAR

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou robed man of justice, take thy place;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thou, his yoke-fellow of equity,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Bench by his side:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To KENT

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: you are o' the commission,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Sit you too.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Let us deal justly.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Sleepest or wakest thou, jolly shepherd?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy sheep be in the corn;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And for one blast of thy minikin mouth,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy sheep shall take no harm.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Pur! the cat is gray.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Arraign her first; 'tis Goneril. I here take my

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: oath before this honourable assembly, she kicked the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: poor king her father.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come hither, mistress. Is your name Goneril?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She cannot deny it.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Cry you mercy, I took you for a joint-stool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And here's another, whose warp'd looks proclaim

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What store her heart is made on. Stop her there!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Arms, arms, sword, fire! Corruption in the place!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: False justicer, why hast thou let her 'scape?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bless thy five wits!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: O pity! Sir, where is the patience now,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That thou so oft have boasted to retain?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Aside]  My tears begin to take his part so much,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: They'll mar my counterfeiting.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The little dogs and all, Tray, Blanch, and

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Sweet-heart, see, they bark at me.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tom will throw his head at them. Avaunt, you curs!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Be thy mouth or black or white,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tooth that poisons if it bite;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Mastiff, grey-hound, mongrel grim,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hound or spaniel, brach or lym,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Or bobtail tike or trundle-tail,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tom will make them weep and wail:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: For, with throwing thus my head,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Dogs leap the hatch, and all are fled.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do de, de, de. Sessa! Come, march to wakes and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: fairs and market-towns. Poor Tom, thy horn is dry.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then let them anatomize Regan; see what breeds

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: about her heart. Is there any cause in nature that

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: makes these hard hearts?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To EDGAR

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You, sir, I entertain for one of my hundred; only I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: do not like the fashion of your garments: you will

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: say they are Persian attire: but let them be changed.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Now, good my lord, lie here and rest awhile.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Make no noise, make no noise; draw the curtains:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: so, so, so. We'll go to supper i' he morning. So, so, so.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And I'll go to bed at noon.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Re-enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Come hither, friend: where is the king my master?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Here, sir; but trouble him not, his wits are gone.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Good friend, I prithee, take him in thy arms;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I have o'erheard a plot of death upon him:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There is a litter ready; lay him in 't,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And drive towards Dover, friend, where thou shalt meet

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Both welcome and protection. Take up thy master:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If thou shouldst dally half an hour, his life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With thine, and all that offer to defend him,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stand in assured loss: take up, take up;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And follow me, that will to some provision

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give thee quick conduct.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Oppressed nature sleeps:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This rest might yet have balm'd thy broken senses,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which, if convenience will not allow,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Stand in hard cure.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Come, help to bear thy master;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thou must not stay behind.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Come, come, away.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt all but EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When we our betters see bearing our woes,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: We scarcely think our miseries our foes.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who alone suffers suffers most i' the mind,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Leaving free things and happy shows behind:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But then the mind much sufferance doth o'er skip,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When grief hath mates, and bearing fellowship.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How light and portable my pain seems now,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When that which makes me bend makes the king bow,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He childed as I father'd! Tom, away!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Mark the high noises; and thyself bewray,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When false opinion, whose wrong thought defiles thee,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: In thy just proof, repeals and reconciles thee.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What will hap more to-night, safe 'scape the king!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Lurk, lurk.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exit
